net.sourceforge.aglets.examples.patterns
Class Writer

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.aglet.Aglet
      net.sourceforge.aglets.examples.patterns.SampleAglet
          net.sourceforge.aglets.examples.patterns.Writer
All Implemented Interfaces:
CloneListener, MobilityListener, PersistencyListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class Writer
extends SampleAglet

Class Writer is used to display a message on a remote aglet server. Given an URL (Agler Resource Locator) it will dispatch a slave (the WriterSlave class) to popup a window with the message on the remote terminal. Finally, the slave returns to its origin host.

Version:
1.00 96/12/28
Author:
Yariv Aridor
See Also:
WriterSlave, Serialized Form

handleMessage

public boolean handleMessage(Message msg)
Description copied from class: Aglet
Handles the message form outside.

Overrides:
handleMessage in class SampleAglet
Parameters:
msg - the message sent to the aglet
Returns:
true if the message was handled. Returns false if the message was not handled. If false is returned, the NotHandledException exception is thrown in the FutureReply.getReply and AgletProxy.sendMessage methods.
See Also:
FutureReply.getReply(), Message.sendReply(), AgletProxy.sendMessage(com.ibm.aglet.message.Message)
